greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct prime indices of n that divide n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65536
example: 60060 has 7 prime indices {1,1,2,3,4,5,6}, all of which divide 60060, and 6 of which are distinct, so a(60060) = 6.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(f = factor(n)[,1]); sum(k=1, #f, !(n % primepi(f[k])));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 19 2019
xref: The version for all prime indices (counted with multiplicity) is A324848.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 18 2019
